Message.Msg: Is aboot az gewd as the utter suk boreds to due sum tight poastings an crap...

Ebay isn't going to do squat! This seller's money is gone for good. PayPricBassturds pulled that same stunt on me a half dozen times. PayPal accepted the unauthorized credit card, but refuses to take responsibility for doing so. PayPric simply reverses the transaction to avoid a loss to PayPric. The seller's fault is they shipped too quick. In PayBassturds transaction reversal email, PayPal emphatically states: "Do not ship the item" -- OOPS! Too Late. The eBay seller is between a rock and hard place, eBay demands fast shipment or DSR's will be whacked. The prompt shipper bears the risk of having the transaction reversed. Chalk it up to the price of doing business on eBay and adjust your selling prices accordingly. Your Ebay prices should be at least 15% higher than you'd normally sell the item elsewhere to compensate for the risk. Higher selling prices are your only insurance against eBay's institutionalized fraud.

Incidentally, just received an email from eBay about new quote "Seller Protection Enhancements" coming this fall. In part Ebay evidently has recognized the buyers are abusing the absolute power eBay gave them. http://announcements.ebay.com/2012/07/fall-2012-seller-update/ However, like every eBay policy change there is a hidden fee increase. If you end an auction item, you'll now pay the full Final Value Fee anyway. Don't list an item if you think it could possibly sell elsewhere. Ebay found a way to lockout a period of time to have the exclusive market for your item, and you pay for it.

Message.Title: How Do You Sell Expensive Items On Ebay ???...Where is the protection?
Message.Msg: Ebay/ Paypal is willing to let a Powerseller get charged back for low priced items without any recourse, how can an Ebay seller sell higher priced items which are worth thousands?...Where is the protection? I see many people selling items for thousands of dollars, their profit might be 10%. One chargeback would wipe out ten sales. For example, a seller sells an item for $3000 and makes a $300 profit. With One chargeback they would have to to sell 10 more just to break even....WHERE IS THE PROTECTION?

Topic.Title: How Do You Sell Expensive Items On Ebay ???...Where is the protection?
